channel.title: I need help about sending me an email, look here for precise details
channel.description:
I made a site, and ill use an HTML code, This is what i need
A big box for the person to type into, and a botton on the bottom saying ''send'' and it will send to my email, example@hotmail.com
Is this possible? if yes, any good steps for me? if wrong forums, lead me to the right one! THANKS!

ohh i know lol i pick up quick when i understand a bit or when i read a good tut[br][size=1]Posted on: January 04, 2007, 05:13:05 PM[/size][hr]here is the pick[/quote]

<?

at the start to

Either that or your host dosn’t support PHP. (Pretty sure it’s the above, though).

item.title: I need help about sending me an email, look here for precise details
item.dc:creator: @sicarius99 sicarius99
item.description:
@sicarius99 wrote:

[code]<?
// declare values
$contact_email = $_POST[‘EmailAddress’];
$contact_subject = $_POST[‘Subject’];
$contact_name = $_POST[‘FullName’];
$contact_message = $_POST[‘Message’];
$mydate = date ( ‘l, F d Y g:i A’,time()+240 );

// where to send e-mail to
$to = ‘(e-mail here)’;

// e-mail subject
$subject = "
(subject here";

// e-mail message
$message = “You have received a contact message:\r\n”

."----------------------------------------------------------------\r\n"
.“Contact Name: $contact_name\r\n”
.“Subject: $contact_subject\r\n”
.“Submitted: $mydate\r\n”
.“From IP: {$_SERVER[‘REMOTE_ADDR’]}\r\n\r\n”
.“Message: $contact_message\r\n”
.“Form Address: {$_SERVER[‘SERVER_NAME’]}{$_SERVER[‘REQUEST_URI’]}”;

$headers = “From: $contact_name <$contact_email>\n”
.“Reply-To: $contact_email\n”
.“X-Mailer: PHP/”.phpversion();

// check for validation, then send the e-mail
if(empty($contact_name) || empty($contact_email) || empty($contact_subject) || empty($contact_message)) {
echo ’

Name:
Subject:
E-mail:
Message:
'; } elseif(!ereg("^[_a-z0-9-]+(\.[_a-z0-9-]+)*@[a-z0-9-]+(\.[a-z0-9-]+)*(\.[a-z]{2,3})$", $contact_email)) { echo "

ERROR: Please enter a valid e-mail address.

"; } else { mail( $to, $subject, $message, $headers ); echo "

Message Sent!

$contact_name,

We will get back to you as soon as possible at $contact_email."; } ?>[/code]

heres the code for a php contact form

were it says (e-mail here) put were you want it to send to and same for subject except put the subject[br][size=1]Posted on: January 03, 2007, 07:05:38 PM[/size][hr]also if you want to see what that looks like in a web page check
http://dastreetstyle.com/contact.php

Read full topic

item.title: I need help about sending me an email, look here for precise details
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

[quote=“alexia, post:7, topic:42534”][quote author=usernamelol link=topic=59381.msg725061#msg725061 date=1167773583]

I am not quite positive on how to do what you have asked, but a simpler way would be to put this code:

<a href="mailto:example@hotmail.com">Click Here To E-Mail Me!</a>

At least… I think that’s it. I haven’t done anything with emails in a while.

-Alexia

That just shows a link and will open Microsoft outlook or whatever.
[/quote]
Okay, captain obvious.

-Alexia[/quote]
o man u pwnd me <3

Read full topic
